content.raw: I tried, and I liked it

<memory> is for std::weak_ptr and std::shared_ptr. I tried to remove it and I got 


```
#!c++
/home/hugo/code/ign-math/include/ignition/math/Frame.hh:32:22: error: expected type-specifier
     using FramePtr = std::shared_ptr<Frame>;


```
content.html:
<memory> is for std::weak_ptr and std::shared_ptr. I tried to remove it and I got 

/home/hugo/code/ign-math/include/ignition/math/Frame.hh:32:22: error: expected type-specifier
     using FramePtr = std::shared_ptr<Frame>;

content.raw: Consider replacing the raw pointer with a `std::unique_ptr`
content.html: Consider replacing the raw pointer with a std::unique_ptr

content.raw: Add `#include` where this class is declared.
I don't think you're using a mutex or a map here, probably it's safe to remove these `include`.
content.html: I don't think you're using a mutex or a map here, probably it's safe to remove these include.

content.raw: I'd suggest to convert it to `std::unique_ptr`
You can remove it if you convert `this->dataPtr` to a `std::unique_ptr`.
content.html: You can remove it if you convert this->dataPtr to a std::unique_ptr.

update.description:
Classes to manage transformation in a tree structure where each frame element has a parent, a pose and unique children. Features:

* Change the local pose of frame elements
* Get a transformation between 2 frames
update.title: Frame_graph
